item.title: Model for learning in class
item.description:
Currently, I am taking a class on Information Theory by Prof. lalitha Sankar while inching forward with my Ph.D. at ASU.

She gave the following question from the famous Thomas & Clover book as a homework question:

Calculate the capacity of the following channel with the probability transistion matrix,

$$\begin{bmatrix}p & 1-p & 0 & 0\\ 1-p & p & 0 & 0\\ 0 & 0 & q & 1-q\\ 0 & 0 & 1-q & q \end{bmatrix}$$

On a first naive look, my mind tilted towards, “Well, you got two channels. Just use the one with best performance”. Intuitive it may seem, this is incorrect. You have 4 input channels at your disposal and using just 2 of them (corresponding to the best channel) would lead you to under-utilizing the system and hence there should be a better way.

It seems the correct answer is to use the channel according to the ratio: $\frac{2^{-H(p)}}{2^{-H(p)} +2^{-H(q)}}$, where $H(\alpha)$ would denote the entropy of Bernoulli($\alpha$).

This got me thinking of a possibility of using this model to analyse the behaviour in the classroom. Consider that you are sitting in a class and the BSC channels model the following :

  1. First BSC channel : Denotes the intensity of the material being taught in class – By this I mean, for a person having full knowledge of measure theory might find an introductory class on Probability a bit easy. Thus the person would have parameter $p\approx \frac{1}{2}$, which indicates the corresponds that channel being noisy $\leftrightarrow$ easy class. This would also mean that a look at the material taught by the prof once every 10 minutes would give him a complete picture of what is happening in class.
  2. Second BSC channel : Models his success with other pursuits in classroom – For me it would be thinking of strategies in board games or working on a different problem. For some others it might be chatting on phone, etc. Thus parameter $q$ models how clearly one can think of that other task being performed while in classroom.

If this is the case, then surprising result comes out of the question posed in the homework assignment – It is information theoritically suboptimal to completely focus on the content being taught in class or completely zone out in your own world.

There is an ideal ratio in which both needs to be pursued during your classroom time.

So, now you have an argument if prof catches you being zoned out in class.
